item.description:
There has been a suggestion to get a bit to eat at Chicks
Drive In across the street from the West Haven Beach.

Then go for a walk on the West Haven Board Walk to
Enjoy the scenery and work off the meal.

A.
http://dinesite.com/i...

dinesite.com/info/rstrnt-364320/%25LegendLink%25

I live in this area.
Please do not plan on walking barefoot on the beach.
There is too much stuff on the beach.

I do not want to have to bring you to the hospital for
Your cut feet. Been there & done that too many
Times when I was younger.

If you are a power walker, then go on a head.
The rest of us will be farther back walking at our own speed.

Members of the Look At Me Now Wellness
Group might be attending this walk.
Some of us in CT are also members of the
LAMN Group.

A.
http://walking.about....

walking.about.com/


B.
http://www.thewalking...

www.thewalkingsite.com/

C.
http://www.medicinene...


www.medicinenet.com/walking/article.htm

There are stores at the end of Campbell Avenue that we can go over to on the way.

There are rest rooms on the way closer to Savin Rock.

I would suggest walking to Bradley Point & back unless others want to
Turn back before there.

If you want to some to the West Haven Beaches some other time;
Directions to West Haven Beaches
From Interstate 95
I-95 Northbound
Take exit 42. Turn left at the end of the exit.
Follow beach signs 3 miles to Captain Thomas Boulevard. Public parkings lots are in both directions.
Turn right onto Captain Thomas Boulevard.
Travel 1 1/2 miles to the South Street public parking lot, the fourth lot on the left.
Turn left onto Captain Thomas Boulevard.
Travel about 1 mile through two traffic lights and turn right at the stop sign.
Follow the water along Beach Street.
The Morse Park public parking lot is a 1/2 mile on the left, after Chicks Drive In.
I-95 Southbound
Take exit 43. Turn left at the end of the exit.
Follow beach signs about 1 1/2 miles to the water. The Morse Park public parking lot is on the right, 100 yards past Captains
Galley Restaurant on Beach Street.
Hours
West Haven beaches are open daily from 9:00 am to dusk.
Lifeguards are on duty from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm Memorial Day through Labor Day.
Daily Parking Rates
$10 (9:00 am to 4:00 pm) $5 (after 4:00 pm)

http://www.cityofwest...

www.cityofwesthaven.com/contentpage.asp?page=Beaches

Other restaurants;

http://www.newengland...

www.newenglandsite.com/ct-westhaven-restaurants.shtml

Any other ideas?
item.how_to_find_us: I will be by the NH Register Box in Park Lot 15 minutes before Meet Up
item.name: Coffee Talkers Walk on the West Haven Boardwalk On 8/30
